intro: Stigmaphyllon maynense, commonly known as the Maynense stigmaphyllon, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its unique leaf structure and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in the understory of rainforests. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces small, hairy fruits. Stigmaphyllon maynense is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
